messages.content: What is the purpose of ComfyUI-Book-Tools?
ComfyUI-Book-Tools is a set of tools that provide features such as image text overlay, prompt selection and scheduling, loop constructs, and special comparators for use with ComfyUI.
What are the requirements for running ComfyUI-Book-Tools?
To run ComfyUI-Book-Tools, you need Python 3.6 or higher, along with the following dependencies: Pillow for image processing, PyTorch for tensor operations, and Numpy.
How can you install the dependencies for ComfyUI-Book-Tools?
You can install the dependencies for ComfyUI-Book-Tools by running the command 'pip install -r requirements.txt' in your terminal or command prompt.
What does the add_text_overlay method in ComfyUI-Book-Tools do?
The add_text_overlay method in ComfyUI-Book-Tools adds text to an image according to specified parameters such as alignment, color, font size, etc.
What are PromptSelector and PromptSchedule used for in ComfyUI-Book-Tools?

PromptSelector and PromptSchedule are classes in ComfyUI-Book-Tools that are used to handle and format text prompts. They support selecting prompts based on input indices and applying pre- and post-text to formatted outputs.
What is the purpose of the Loop, LoopStart, and LoopEnd classes in ComfyUI-Book-Tools?
The Loop, LoopStart, and LoopEnd classes in ComfyUI-Book-Tools are designed to facilitate custom loop constructs that can dynamically handle iteration based on runtime conditions.
What is the EndQueue in ComfyUI-Book-Tools used for?
The EndQueue in ComfyUI-Book-Tools is used for conditioning the end of the current queue.
How can you contribute to ComfyUI-Book-Tools?
Contributions to ComfyUI-Book-Tools are welcome. You can fork the repository, make your suggested changes, and submit a pull request.
Under what license is ComfyUI-Book-Tools distributed?
ComfyUI-Book-Tools is licensed under the MIT License.
